conclusion: Understanding how the position and size of shadows change with light source movement
Light source is above objects casting shadows A, B, C, and D
Shadows are cast in specific directions and have certain sizes
Light source moving forward will be closer to objects affecting shadow size and position
Shadows will generally become smaller as light source moves forward
Shadows will move further away from objects as light source moves forward
Shadow A will become smaller and move further away from the cake
Shadow B will become smaller and move further away from the yellow object
Shadow C will become smaller and move further away from the milk carton
Shadow D will become smaller and move further away from the baseball
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D will become smaller and move further away
